poem:
**Harmony in Accolade**

Emily sings  
from Garramilla's heart—  
a voice weaving tides,  
Warnindhilyagwa grace,  
awards like blossoms,  
echoing waves of  
Lordy Lordy.  
  
Under stars,  
each note a feather,  
fluttering on a wind  
of shared songs.  

Applause blooms,  
music entwined,  
in the gentle dance  
of recognition.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "National Indigenous Music awards 2025: Emily Wurramara wins artist of the year Emily Wurramara has won artist of the year at the 21st National Indigenous Music awards (Nimas), held in Garramilla/Darwin on Saturday night. The Darwin-born Warnindhilyagwa woman was nominated alongside rap collective 3%, Yolŋu surf rockers King Stingray, duo Birdz and Fred Leone, and singers Jessica Mauboy, Emma Donovan and Radical Son. Wurramara also picked up film clip of the year for Lordy Lordy,". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
